title: Lafuente (footballer, born 1907)
text:
Ramón de la Fuente Leal, nicknamed Lafuente (31 December 1907 – 15 September 1973) was a Spanish <a href="association%20football">association football</a>er. He was born in <a href="Bilbao">Bilbao</a>. During his career he played for <a href="Barakaldo%20CF">Barakaldo CF</a> (1923–1926), <a href="Athletic%20Bilbao">Athletic Bilbao</a> (1926–1934), and <a href="Athletic%20Madrid">Athletic Madrid</a> (Atlético de Madrid, 1934–1936). He earned 8 caps for the <a href="Spain%20national%20football%20team">Spain national football team</a>, and participated in the <a href="1934%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1934 FIFA World Cup</a>. At Athletic, he was the most experienced member of what became a famous and successful forward line, along with <a href="Jos%C3%A9%20Iraragorri">José Iraragorri</a>, <a href="Chirri%20II">Chirri II</a>, <a href="Agust%C3%ADn%20Sauto%20Arana">Bata</a> and <a href="Guillermo%20Gorostiza">Guillermo Gorostiza</a>.
He later coached <a href="Deportivo%20de%20La%20Coru%C3%B1a">Deportivo de La Coruña</a> and died in <a href="Madrid">Madrid</a>.
